data.explanation: Which becomes an interrogative adjective when it comes before a noun and asks a question, e.g., Which book?

data.explanation: My shows ownership and comes before a noun. Mine is a pronoun, not an adjective.

data.explanation: Comparative adjectives compare two things and usually end in -er for short adjectives.
options: This box is heavier than that one

data.explanation: Superlative adjectives compare three or more nouns to indicate the extreme limit of a quality. Superlative adjectives compare more than two and often end in -est.

data.explanation: Good has irregular forms: good → better → best.
